introduction: A week ago, an unusual solar activity destroyed space navigation systems
and life-support devices on multiple spaceships, stranding astronauts
on the Moon, Mars, and Mercury.
A former Space Force Astronaut Carl Walker Jr. receives a call from NASA.
He is asked to do his one last dance: a Search and Rescue mission.
Given the urgency of the situation, the international community
manages to cooperate and quickly construct one special spacecraft.
But time is not on Walker’s side.
Colonel Walker must rescue every stranded astronaut
and safely bring them home in just one trip.
NASA expects Colonel Walker to bring back at least 4/5 (four-fifths)
instructions:  * Mission * 
Rescue stranded astronauts and return to Earth. Keep an eye on your FUEL
HEALTH, and remaining OXYGEN as you traverse space. Fuel and health may
be replenished, but oxygen can't! Once anything hits 0, its GAME OVER!
 * HOW TO * 
> travel between planets 
Click on the SPACECRAFT, then select a PLANET.
> repair 
If the SPACECRAFT is damaged, you can use the REPAIR button.
To use "repair", there must be at least one engineer onboard.
> refuel 
Travel to the STATION and click the PUMP to refuel
It's limited, use it wisely.
> load passengers 
To LOAD passengers, use click the ASTRONAUTS on a planet.
Be careful, some planets may have OBSTACLES to clear first!
> unload passengers 
Travel to EARTH and click the NASA STATION to UNLOAD
Don't return until you've saved everyone.
> use items 
Click the OBSTACLE on a planet to use up the required ITEM.
> help 
To see this menu again, click "help".
> quit 
To quit the program, click quit in the menu "quit".
noEngineerOnBoardAlert: Mission Control: You need to have at least one engineer on board to repair the ship.
npcDialogue: ...how could I ever forget that alien invasion? *cries*
I'm never leaving my home again.
Please get me back home to my family safely...
userLost: You failed to rescue enough astronauts while they are alive :(
